author: VNExplorer
title: UK weather: Exact time thunderstorms will end as Brits face huge hail and 'danger to life'
text: Millions of Brits face thunderstorms, hail and flooding today (Thursday, August 1) - and weather forecasters are warning the grim conditions may last longer than initially expected. It comes following consecutive days where temperatures exceeded 30C. The mercury is expected to rise to around 30C again today in London, reaching the high-20Cs on the south coast, the Midlands and in Wales too, but the heatwave will be hampered by storms. The Met Office has a yellow thunderstorm warning in place until 11.59pm tonight. It covers almost all of England and parts of Wales, with people warned of "power cuts" as well as "fast flowing or deep floodwater" that could pose a "danger to life". However, forecasters now expect the thunderstorms to continue into Friday (August 2) - and possibly longer. In an update on Facebook, Exacta Weather forecaster James Madden said we should see temperatures reach the "high-20Cs" again on Friday, before they really start to cool off. This could bring a "further risk of developing thunderstorms" as we head into the weekend. Temperatures could hit 30C once again today (Thursday, August 1) As for today, Madden identified "central, southern and eastern England" as where the risk of "localised flooding and/or large hail" is greatest. He then expects temperatures to warm up again from August 10 to August 15, and previously warned this second heatwave could be "more extreme" than the current one. Experts at Netweather have a "severe" thunderstorm warning in place until 8am on Friday. They have also produced a map identifying exactly where is most at risk over the next 24 hours. A huge swathe of England, from the Midlands down to the south coast, is marked as having a "60% risk" of thunderstorms. An area centring around the West Midlands, Warwickshire, Gloucestershire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire is flagged as being particularly at risk of "large hail". A huge swathe of England, from the Midlands down to the south coast, faces a '60% risk' on thunderstorms The Met Office expects Friday to be "warm for most" again, with advanced weather modelling maps showing highs of 28C in the south-east and east of England. Most of the rest of England could reach 21C to 25C, but temperatures look set to be a few notches cooler in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. The Met Office forecast for Friday states: "Cloud and rain edging into the northwest where it will also be rather breezy. Mostly dry elsewhere with sunny spells, a few heavy showers in the east. Warm for most."

author: VNExplorer
title: Masters of the Air: Hanks and Spielberg’s spectacular war story is the first must-watch show of 2024
text:
Photograph: Robert Viglasky/Apple
It’s rare I do this when I watch a show, but I had to keep pausing and texting a number of my friends about Masters of the Air (Friday 26 January, Apple TV+), because it felt important to let them know. “Have you heard of Masters of the Air?” I would say, and they would say no. And I’d type out – Austin Butler’s perfect face frozen mid-toothpick-chew on my screen – “It’s like Band of Brothers but in the sky. Go and watch the trailer now.” And exactly two minutes and 31 seconds later I would get the reply: “oh shit.” And then: “oh SHIT!”
It’s Masters of the Air week, then, and this is very exciting. It’s sort of like – how would I describe it? Like Band of Brothers, but in the sky. They got the old production team together – no-namers Steven Spielberg, Tom Hanks and Gary Goetzman – and got Cary Joji Fukunaga back where he belongs, which is directing all-timer episodes of TV. (He takes the helm for the first four episodes of this limited series – the man who gave us True Detective season one and all of Maniac! Back on TV!). They threw somewhere between $250m and $300m at it, which always works, and they assembled an unbelievable cast: Austin Butler, who you will remember from sending himself mad playing Elvis in a film that turned out to just be a music video, is one of the leads opposite Callum Turner, who is about to be the UK’s most Googled man. The rest of the cast list goes on for ever, so I won’t get to everyone, but you’ve got: Bel Powley, Anthony Boyle and Stephen Campbell Moore. You’ve got nepotism’s very own Raff Law and Sawyer Spielberg. And, due to a quirk of filming (Masters has been in production since 2012; it defected from HBO to Apple TV+ in 2019, becoming Apple Studios’ first in-house series; it was filmed, and delayed, and filmed again across 2021, dogged by Covid), it accidentally cast two of 2024’s ascendant stars, so Ncuti Gatwa is in, as is Barry Keoghan.
It’s Butler and Turner who dominate this one, though. It’s amazing that anyone just walks around looking like Austin Butler – he is magnetically good-looking, almost breathtakingly so, in an old-school gravity-absorbing way you thought they stopped making in the 50s – and he prowls around Masters of the Air, purring every line into Callum Turner’s ear. Butler plays Maj Gale “Buck” Clevan, and Turner is John “Bucky” Egan, and you think it would be really annoying that they have more-or-less the same name but it isn’t, not even once. It’s just astonishingly polished. The first episode lurches from a flirting-and-dancing and no-we-fly-out-in-the-morning, early-night-sir bar scene into rat-a-tat hold-your-breath action sequence so quickly it makes your head spin. And then you’re in, white knuckles throughout, each time any member of the 100th squadron takes off you feel a low clunk of dread.
Band of Brothers (land) and its sister series The Pacific (sea) did the same thing Masters of the Air (sky) is doing: costing a lot of money, having an impeccable cast, being very good, and, crucially, toeing a careful line. It does not glorify war but depicts how impossibly young men dealt with it, then shows the true violent horror in a series of visceral, genre-defining action scenes. In Masters, the action sequences are superb – you are on the outside of a bomber with an engine failing, or you are hanging out over clouds with nothing but a crackling window between you and oblivion, or you are watching Barry Keoghan and Austin Butler do a take-off check-list from the nose of the propeller (an oddly gripping scene: I’d probably watch these two read a phonebook at each other).
But it’s the human scenes in between that make you care about who does and doesn’t survive each mission, and they are done amazingly, too: not over-egged, never cloying, just guys being dudes, occasionally taking a sepia-tinged photo out of their pocket and looking at it, occasionally doing a really firm handshake instead of having an emotion, sometimes drinking a whisky after their best friend just died then slapping on a smile. Sales of aviator jackets are about to go through the roof, the most annoying man you know (me) is going to start saying “wilco” in polite conversation, and Masters of the Air is going to be 2024’s first series that you rewatch entirely before the year even ends.

author: RFM
title: Jogadores protegem crianças do frio e da chuva, antes do jogo, em Chaves - RFM
text: Jogadores protegem crianças do frio e da chuva, antes do jogo, em Chaves Foi um gesto simples, mas muito ternurento. Jogadores do Sporting protegeram as crianças, que os acompanharam em campo, do frio e da chuva, em Chaves No meio do frio cortante e da chuva intensa, que se sentiu, este sábado, em Chaves, os jogadores do Sporting protagonizaram um momento que aqueceu os corações de todos. Antes do apito inicial da partida, o estádio estava envolto num manto cinzento de nevoeiro e o frio era de fazer bater os dentes. Perante a visão de crianças destemidas, encharcadas pela chuva e tremendo de frio, com o seu equipamento de manga curta vestido, os jogadores do Sporting não hesitaram. Sem aviso prévio, eles despiram os seus próprios casacos e colocaram por cima das crianças, para as aquecer. Foi um gesto simples, mas muito ternurento, e que ficará para sempre na memória destas crianças. Enquanto os adeptos testemunhavam, das bancadas, este ato de generosidade, o estádio preparava-se para aquecer para mais um grande jogo. (Imagens: Reprodução Twitter)

author: Redacción Los Andes
title: Video y decepción: escondió una cámara en la casa de sus padres para ver quién robaba y descubrió que era su novio
text: Tras instalar una cámara oculta para capturar al responsable de robar los ahorros de sus padres jubilados, una joven se llevó una decepcionante sorpresa. Es que, al revisar las imágenes luego de un nuevo hurto, descubrió que era su pareja de hace 4 años quién se escabullía en la casa de sus suegros Una joven oriunda de Pergamino, Buenos Aires, se cansó de que sus padres fueran víctimas de un modalidad de robo “hormiga”, cuyo objetivo principal es pasar desapercibido. En rigor, se trata del hurto sistemático que consiste en extraer pequeñas cantidades de dinero (o productos) en un período de tiempo espaciado. Lo que más le quitaba el sueño a la bonaerense era cómo se cometía el delito, ya que en la vivienda de sus progenitores no había señales de puertas forzadas ni otros faltantes. Para acabar con la situación, tuvo la idea de colocar una cámara oculta en el lugar donde sus padres guardaban sus ahorros y esperó el regreso del delincuente. Luego de que la pareja sufriera otro robo, la joven revisó inmediatamente la cámara y se encontró con una inquietante verdad: su pareja era el culpable. Como se puede ver en las imágenes, el hombre ingresaba por la ventana de una de las habitaciones de la vivienda, caminaba con cautela hasta donde estaba el dinero y extraía algunos billetes. De la misma forma en que ingresaba, salía. Su modus operandi funcionaba con éxito porque, tras pasar cuatro años en una relación con la pergaminense, la joven le ofreció que se fuera a vivir a su casa, la cual se encontraba en el mismo terreno que la de sus padres. El video fue compartido por la joven en las redes sociales y se viralizó a tal punto que supera el millón de reproducciones en diferentes plataformas. “Ya lo decía mi abuelita: “nunca terminamos de conocer realmente como son las personas”, “Debe estar destrozada... Es como una metida de cuernos pero con mentiras, fotos y videos... Qué dolor”, “Si puso una cámara y no le contó al novio es porque también sospechaba de él”, fueron algunas de las reacciones de los usuarios sobre el insólito hecho.

author: globo.com
title: Em Paris, Brasil conquista medalhas no judô, goalball e natação, nesta quinta | Olimpíada 2024 | Valor Econômico
text:
Goalball A seleção brasileira masculina de goaball bateu a China por 5 a 3 e ficou com o bronze – em Tóquio-2020 o Brasil tinha levado o ouro. Já a equipe feminina da modalidade perdeu para as chinesas por 6 a 0 e ficou em quarto lugar.
Natação
Na natação, o catarinense Talisson Glock ficou em segundo lugar nos 100m livre, na classe S6 (limitação físico-motora), conquistando a prata com o tempo de 1min05seg27. Ele melhorou sua posição em Tóquio, onde foi bronze.
Uma das estrelas brasileiras da modalidade aquática nesta edição dos jogos, a pernambucana Carol Santiago abocanhou mais uma medalha para a sua coleção ao levar a prata nos 100m peito, na classe SB12 (destinada a nadadores com deficiência visual), com o tempo de 1min15s62. Carol, que encerrou sua participação nesta Paralimpíada, é a brasileira que mais conquistou medalhas de ouro em Jogos Paralímpicos.
“Estou muito feliz. Esta é uma prova que gosto muito. Fico muito feliz de encerrar a Paralimpíada com esta prata”, declarou a nadadora, que, com a prata de hoje, soma dez medalhas em Paralimpíadas.
Seu saldo em 2024 foi de três medalhas douradas (50 metros livre S13, 100 metros livre S12 e 100 metros costas S12) e duas pratas (no revezamento 4x100 metros livre misto 49 pontos e 100 metros peito da classe SB12).
A terceira conquista do Brasil na natação nesta quinta veio com a potiguar Cecília Araújo , que ficou com a prata na prova dos 50m livre da classe S8 (limitação físico-motora). Ela fechou a prova com 30s31.
Maria Carolina Santiago exibe a prata conquistada na prova dos 100m peito, classe SB12, na piscina da Arena La Defense, em Paris — Foto: Alessandra Cabral/CPB Mais recente Próxima Brasil ultrapassa a marca de 50 medalhas na Paralimpíada de Paris

author: Paul Terpstra
title: Apple Unveils iPad Mini 7 with A17 Pro Chip and Apple Intelligence
text:
Apple has announced the iPad Mini 7, which comes equipped with the A17 Pro chip and advanced Apple Intelligence features. This latest model, set to launch on October 23, brings a notable boost in processing power and graphics capabilities, following the redesign that Apple introduced in 2021. With its new features, the iPad Mini 7 aims to deliver an improved experience for both work and play.
Enhanced Performance with the A17 Pro
The A17 Pro chip, previously seen in the iPhone 15 Pro models, powers the iPad Mini 7. This chip provides a 30% increase in CPU performance and a 25% boost in GPU capabilities compared to the previous generation. The A17 Pro also includes hardware-accelerated ray tracing and dynamic shading, which elevate the device’s graphics quality. This makes the iPad Mini 7 ideal for demanding apps and tasks, from gaming to professional software.
Apple Pencil Pro and Improved Storage Options
For the first time, the iPad Mini supports the Apple Pencil Pro, allowing users to take full advantage of advanced stylus features. The 8.3-inch Liquid Retina display enhances the experience, offering a high-quality canvas for drawing, note-taking, and more. In addition, Apple has increased the base storage to 128GB, with 256GB and 512GB options available, giving users more flexibility for apps, media, and files.
Connectivity and Other Upgrades
The iPad Mini 7 also includes several connectivity improvements. It now supports Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 5.3, ensuring faster, more stable connections. Apple has removed the Nano-SIM slot, focusing solely on eSIM technology, which aligns with its recent trend toward digital-only connectivity.
Priced at $499 for the 128GB model, the iPad Mini 7 targets users looking for a powerful, portable device that combines Apple’s latest technology. With its enhanced performance, graphics, and compatibility with the Apple Pencil Pro, the iPad Mini 7 sets a new standard for Apple’s compact tablet lineup.

author: @welt
title: Gewerkschaft verkündet Tarifeinigung bei Dönerfabrik Birtat - WELT
text:
Mehrere Tage ist bei der schwäbischen Dönerfabrik Birtat für bessere Bezahlung und einen Tarifvertrag gekämpft worden. Nun gibt es eine Einigung. Wie sieht sie aus?
Anzeige Im Tarifkonflikt beim Dönerspieß-Hersteller Birtat gibt es eine Einigung - es ist zugleich nach Gewerkschaftsangaben der erste Tarifvertrag in der Dönerfleischindustrie. Für die rund 120 Beschäftigten wurde der Einstiegslohn auf 2.600 Euro festgelegt, wie die Gewerkschaft Nahrung-Genuss-Gaststätten (NGG) und das Unternehmen Meat World SE (Birtat) in Murr bei Ludwigsburg gemeinsam mitteilten. Ferner sei eine Anhebung der Entgelte in zwei Stufen im Gesamtumfang von bis zu 17 Prozent in der Spitze bei einer Laufzeit bis Ende 2026 vereinbart worden. Für eine direkte Stellungnahme war das Unternehmen zunächst nicht erreichbar.
Die Gewerkschaft NGG forderte eine Erhöhung der Entgelte um 375 Euro und einen Tarifvertrag. Bisher wurde die Arbeit an elf unterschiedlichen Tagen zeitweise niedergelegt. NGG-Verhandlungsführerin Magdalena Krüger sagte, dieser Tarifabschluss sei ein historisches Ergebnis in der Dönerfleischbranche und ein Erfolg der Beschäftigten. Cihan Karaman, der Pressesprecher der Meat World SE erklärte laut der gemeinsamen Mitteilung: «Wir sind überzeugt, dass dieser Vertrag nicht nur Planungssicherheit schafft, sondern auch das Vertrauen und die Zusammenarbeit zwischen Unternehmen und Beschäftigten stärkt.»
Birtat gehört zur Meat World SE und ist der NGG zufolge der größte Hersteller von Dönerspießen in Baden-Württemberg - und einer der führenden Anbieter in Deutschland. In der Fabrik stecken die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter Fleisch vom Kalb, Hähnchen oder Rind auf Spieße - und geben dem Ganzen die traditionelle Form. Die Spieße werden dann schockgefrostet und ausgeliefert.
dpa-infocom GmbH

author: maicolengel butac
title: ByoBlu e le "auto elettriche spiate"
text:
Un’amica ci ha segnalato un servizio “scoop” di ByoBlu.
Titolo del servizio:
FUGA DI DATI IN CASA VOLKSWAGEN: RINTRACCIATI GLI SPOSTAMENTI DEI POSSESSORI DI AUTO ELETTRICA Autrice del servizio Arianna Graziato.
Partiamo dai fatti, quanto riportato da ByoBlu è veramente stato spiegato da Der Spiegel, ma con alcune significative mancanze . la prima e più importante, è che il fatto non riguarda la scelta consapevole di “spiare” gli utenti ma la configurazione errata di un software , e coinvolge i veicoli elettrici non in quanto elettrici ma poiché il software che era stato configurato nella maniera errata era quello di gestione di quel tipo di veicoli ; la stessa cosa poteva riguardare software di altre flotte o di altre tipologie. Il problema difatti non riguarda la motorizzazione dei veicoli, ma la scarsa attenzione data alla programmazione del software da parte degli ingegneri.
La denuncia a Der Spiegel è arrivata dal Chaos Computer Club, che ha segnalato la cosa alla stessa Volkswagen la quale appena notato il problema si è affrettata a risolverlo. Purtroppo i dati in questione sono rimasti sul web senza protezioni di sorta troppo a lungo. A oggi, però, l’unica cosa che è stata chiarita è che quei dati erano disponibili per chi li avesse trovati, ma senza che sia stato dimostrato che – a parte gli informatici del CCC – altri abbiano avuto accesso a quelle informazioni . Il fatto che, attraverso una configurazione errata nei sistemi della filiale Cariad, i dati sensibili (come la posizione GPS precisa, gli orari di accensione/spegnimento dei motori e persino i profili personali degli utenti) di circa 800mila veicoli elettrici siano rimasti accessibili per mesi in un cloud Amazon non protetto non significa che automaticamente siano stati trovati e sfruttati da soggetti con intenzioni maligne .
Non vogliamo affatto minimizzare il problema, ma vorremmo che fosse chiaro che non è una questione che riguarda solo “i veicoli elettrici” ma in generale la mancanza di trasparenza nella gestione delle informazioni da parte dei produttori di moderni veicoli automobilistici . Non ho un’auto elettrica ma ho un’app che mi permette di gestirla a distanza, la stessa app potrebbe condividere i miei dati su cloud non protetti e i dati che potrebbe condividere sono gli stessi, visto che la mia auto ha un GPS e una memoria interna condivisa con la app che traccia dove vado, quando ci vado, quanto consumo ecc ecc.
Pertanto il giornalismo serio, invece che attaccare le elettriche o una specifica casa automobilistica, dovrebbe evidenziare come il possibile problema possa riguardare qualsiasi tipo di veicolo senza demonizzarne uno specifico tipo, e magari porre in evidenza il problema in sé .
L’UE, grazie al Data Act che entrerà in vigore nel 2025 , richiederà alle case automobilistiche di offrire un accesso semplice e gratuito ai dati dei proprietari dei veicoli, limitando la discrezionalità dei produttori nella gestione di queste informazioni sensibili.
Volkswagen, o meglio la sua filiale Cariad, ha dichiarato a Der Spiegel che:
I dati raccolti erano pseudonimizzati , quindi non direttamente collegabili agli utenti senza ulteriori elaborazioni. Nel caso specifico le informazioni servivano a migliorare le funzionalità delle batterie e la loro gestione. I dati non erano progettati per creare profili personali o movimenti dettagliati degli utenti, e i ricercatori del CCC sarebbero riusciti a fare collegamenti solo grazie alla combinazione di più dataset e “un alto livello di competenza tecnica” . Come crediamo di aver ben specificato, il problema non sono le auto elettriche ma la gestione dei dati da parte di case automobilistiche che fino a pochi anni fa al massimo si occupavano di progettare motori e carrozzerie, e invece oggi devono pensare a veicoli moderni dove la componente informatica, e quindi anche la gestione dei dati, è sempre più presente . Poco conta il tipo di motorizzazione che hanno i veicoli, come ben sa chi ha acquistato un veicolo dotato di navigatore negli ultimi dieci anni. Il problema è la fragilità delle policy sulla protezione dei dati in un settore come quello automobilistico , che sta evolvendo molto velocemente.
maicolengel at butac punto it
Se ti è piaciuto l’articolo, sostienici su Patreon o su PayPal ! Può bastare anche il costo di un caffè!
Un altro modo per sostenerci è acquistare uno dei libri consigliati sulla nostra pagina Amazon, la trovi qui .
BUTAC vi aspetta anche su Telegram con il canale con tutti gli aggiornamenti e il gruppo di discussione, segnalazione e quattro chiacchiere con la nostra community .

author: Rick Barbero The Register-Herald
title: Orphaned osprey returned to the wild in Gauley Bridge | State & Region | register-herald.com
text: A young osprey discovered by an area photographer has gotten a second chance in the wild after its mother was found to be dead in the nest in Gauley Bridge. Photographer Kim Ayers notified Three Rivers Avian Center (TRAC) on June 7 that a female osprey appeared to be dead in the nest on top of the railroad trestle at Gauley Bridge, Executive Director of Three River Avian Center Wendy Perrone. ”We would not be able to get there before dark, so we started working the phones to find a volunteer who was closer. Matt Carpenter, an experienced climber, volunteered to come from Fayetteville and rescue the chicks,” Perrone said. Carpenter and two friends, Lindsay Hermanns, a wildlife biologist, and Amber Jaxon joined in the rescue effort. The chicks were rescued by 8:30 p.m., that evening. The mother osprey had evidently been dead for a few days. Kim Ayers joined Carpenter and his friends to meet Perrone and Three Rivers Avian Center’s Education Director Ron Perrone at 9:30 p.m., in Beckley, and the chicks were brought to TRAC. Perrone said the chicks spent their time there being fed donated culled fish from the WV DNR’s Tate Lohr Fish Hatchery in Oakvale. ”Once they were old enough to eat on their own, they were moved to the Leon Wilson Flyway in TRAC’s Flight Barn. One chick was not as strong as the other and ended up passing away in early July. The remaining chick has thrived and was ready to return to his hatch area near the railroad trestle in Gauley Bridge Thursday afternoon,” Perrone said. There are still osprey coming to the nest site, so we are hopeful that they will show the young osprey how to catch his own fish. Osprey are mostly fish eaters, and are known for their dramatic plunges into water to catch their food. Osprey have gradually been increasing in numbers in West Virginia, and can now be found along major waterways throughout the state. An investigation is underway by the WV Division Of Natural Resources police into the cause of the mother osprey’s death, Perrone said.

organizations.name: three rivers avian center wendy perrone

author: Анастасия Постоенко
title: Россия атаковала Украину 63 дронами 12 июня - какие последствия | Новини.live
text:
Россия атаковала Украину дронами с пяти направлений — что сбили
Россия атаковала Украину 12 июня дронами
В ночь на 12 июня российские войска осуществили массированную атаку по территории Украины, выпустив 63 ударных беспилотника типа Shahed и другие дроны-имитации. Вражеские аппараты запускались с направлений Курска, Орла, Миллерово, Приморско-Ахтарска (РФ), а также из оккупированного Крыма (Чауда).
Об этом сообщила пресс-служба Воздушных сил ВСУ.
Россия атаковала Украину 12 июня дронами
Главными направлениями удара стали Харьковская, Донецкая и Одесская области. Воздушную атаку отражали подразделения авиации, зенитные ракетные войска, силы радиоэлектронной борьбы, системы беспилотного перехвата и мобильные огневые группы Сил обороны Украины.
По состоянию на 9:00 утра было обезврежено 49 вражеских беспилотников, из них 28 — уничтожено средствами огневого поражения, еще 21 — подавлено или потеряно благодаря работе РЭБ. Атака задела восток, юг и север Украины.
В то же время зафиксировано попадание дронов в семи локациях. Еще в четырех случаях зафиксировано падение обломков сбитых беспилотников.
Напомним, в Харьковской ОГА подытожили последствия российских атак по региону за сутки.
Вчера, 11 июня, Россия применила большее количество беспилотников.
